description.original: This Obsidian plugin lets you customize your codeblocks in editing, and reading mode as well.
description.translation: This Obsidian plugin lets you customize your codeblocks in editing, and reading mode as well.

dict.Notice(\"Could not copy to your clipboar: Notice("Could not copy to your clipboard")
dict.Notice(`Theme \"${this.plugin.settings.T: Notice(`Theme "${this.plugin.settings.ThemeName}" restored to its original state!`)
dict.Notice(\"Select a theme first to delete\: Notice("Select a theme first to delete")
dict.Notice(\"You cannot delete the default t: Notice("You cannot delete the default themes")
dict.Notice(\"Set a name for your theme!\"): Notice("Set a name for your theme!")
dict.Notice(\"Default themes restored to thei: Notice("Default themes restored to their original state!")

dict.Notice(`\"${this.plugin.settings.alterna: Notice(`"${this.plugin.settings.alternateHighlightColorName}" is not a valid color name.`)
dict.Notice(\"You cannot override the default: Notice("You cannot override the default hl parameter.")
dict.Notice(\"You cannot override the fold pa: Notice("You cannot override the fold parameter.")
dict.Notice(`A color with the name \"${this.p: Notice(`A color with the name "${this.plugin.settings.alternateHighlightColorName}" already exists.`)
dict.Notice(`${propDisplayText} is already de: Notice(`${propDisplayText} is already defined for code block language "${languageName}"`)
dict.Notice(`Updated ${linkUpdateCount} code: Notice(`Updated ${linkUpdateCount} code block links in ${fileCount} files.`)
dict..error(\"Invalid JSON content in the SVG: .error("Invalid JSON content in the SVG configuration file:", error)
dict.name: \"Restore folding state of all cod: name: "Restore folding state of all code blocks to default"
dict.name: \"Indent code block by one level\": name: "Indent code block by one level"
dict.name: \"Unindent code block by one level: name: "Unindent code block by one level"
dict.description: \"Unexpected element after: description: "Unexpected element after head. Expected the element before `</head>`"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `>` or `->`. E: description: "Unexpected `>` or `->`. Expected `-->` to close comments"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c`. Expected: description: "Unexpected `%c`. Expected `[0-9]` for decimal references or `[0-9a-fA-F]` for hexadecimal references"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `<![CDATA[` in: description: "Unexpected `<![CDATA[` in HTML. Remove it, use a comment, or encode special characters instead"
dict.description: \"Unexpectedly high charact: description: "Unexpectedly high character reference. Expected character references to be at most hexadecimal 10ffff (or decimal 1114111)"
description: "Unexpectedly closing tag. Expected other tags to be closed first"
dict.description: \"Unexpected control charac: description: "Unexpected control character `%x`. Expected a non-control code point, 0x00, or ASCII whitespace"
dict.description: \"Unexpectedly control char: description: "Unexpectedly control character in reference. Expected a non-control code point, 0x00, or ASCII whitespace"
dict.description: \"Unexpected text character: description: "Unexpected text character `%c`. Only use text in `<noscript>`s in `<body>`"
dict.description: \"Unexpectedly double attri: description: "Unexpectedly double attribute. Expected attributes to occur only once"
dict.description: \"Unexpected end tag. Expec: description: "Unexpected end tag. Expected no end tag or another end tag"
dict.description: \"Unexpected end of file. E: description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected tag name instead"
description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected `]]>` to close the CDATA"
description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected `-->` to close the comment"
description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected a valid doctype (such as `<!doctype html>`)"
description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected text or a closing tag"
description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected `>` to close the tag"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c-1`. Expect: description: "Unexpected `%c-1`. Expected `-->` to close the comment"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c`. Expected: description: "Unexpected `%c`. Expected `<!--` to open the comment"
description: "Unexpected `%c`. Expected an ASCII letter instead"
dict.description: \"Unexpected doctype. Expec: description: "Unexpected doctype. Expected doctype before head"
dict.description: \"Unexpected start tag `<he: description: "Unexpected start tag `<head>`. Expected `<head>` directly after doctype"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c-1`. Expect: description: "Unexpected `%c-1`. Expected an attribute value or no `%c-1` instead"
dict.description: \"Expected a `<!doctype htm: description: "Expected a `<!doctype html>` before anything else"
dict.description: \"Unexpected doctype end at: description: "Unexpected doctype end at `%c`. Expected `html` instead"
description: "Unexpected `<noscript>`. Expected a closing tag or a meta element"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point. Do: description: "Unexpected code point. Do not use noncharacters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point `%x: description: "Unexpected code point `%x`. Do not use noncharacters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point. Do: description: "Unexpected code point. Do not use NULL characters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected end of file. E: description: "Unexpected end of file. Expected closing tag instead"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point. Do: description: "Unexpected code point. Do not use lone surrogate characters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point `%x: description: "Unexpected code point `%x`. Do not use lone surrogate characters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c`. Expected: description: "Unexpected `%c`. Expected whitespace, `/`, `>`, `=`, or probably an ASCII letter"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c`. Quote th: description: "Unexpected `%c`. Quote the attribute value to include it"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c`. Add an a: description: "Unexpected `%c`. Add an attribute name before it"
dict.description: \"Unexpected code point `%x: description: "Unexpected code point `%x`. Do not use NULL characters in HTML"
dict.description: \"Unexpected `%c-1`. Expect: description: "Unexpected `%c-1`. Expected it followed by `>` or in a quoted attribute value"
dict.description: \"Unexpected character refe: description: "Unexpected character reference. Expected known named character references"
dict..setName(\"Enable automatically updating: .setName("Enable automatically updating links on file rename")
dict..setName(\"Enable bracket highlight for: .setName("Enable bracket highlight for non matching brackets")
dict..setName(\"Always show 'Copy Code' butto: .setName("Always show 'Copy Code' button for collapsed code blocks")
dict..setName(\"Disable folding for code bloc: .setName("Disable folding for code blocks without fold or unfold specified")
dict..setDesc(\"Create your theme with the cu: .setDesc("Create your theme with the current colors and settings")
dict..setDesc(\"Select which settings group y: .setDesc("Select which settings group you want to modify.")
dict..setDesc(\"By default the plugin is disa: .setDesc("By default the plugin is disabled in source mode. You can enable it in source mode as well using this toggle.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, you can set the c: .setDesc("If enabled, you can set the color for the active line (including codeblocks).")
dict..setDesc(\"Define languages, separated b: .setDesc("Define languages, separated by a comma, to which the plugin should not apply. You can use a wildcard (*) either at the beginning, or at the end. For example: ad-* will exclude codeblocks where the language starts with ad- e.g.: ad-info, ad-error etc.")
dict..setDesc(\"Restore all settings of all t: .setDesc("Restore all settings of all the default themes to their original state.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, you can set the c: .setDesc("If enabled, you can set the color for the active line inside codeblocks only.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, indentation lines: .setDesc("If enabled, indentation lines will be shown in reading view.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, you can use links: .setDesc("If enabled, you can use links in the header, and code blocks as well. In code blocks, you must comment them to work! Examples: [[Document1]], [[Document1|DisplayText]], [[Document1#Paragraph|DisplayText]], [[Document1#^<BlockId>|DisplayText]], [DisplayText](Link), http://example.com etc.")
dict..setDesc(\"To enable this setting, enabl: .setDesc("To enable this setting, enable links usage option first! If enabled, code block links will be automatically updated, when a file is renamed. Please read the README for more information!")
dict..setDesc(\"If you click next to a bracke: .setDesc("If you click next to a bracket, and if the corresponding opening/closing bracket has been found both of them will be highlighted.")
dict..setDesc(`If you click next to a bracket: .setDesc(`If you click next to a bracket, and it doesn't have a corresponding pair, or the pair does not match the opening/closing bracket (e.g: print("hello"] ), they will be highlighted.`)
dict..setDesc('If enabled, all code blocks ar: .setDesc('If enabled, all code blocks are folded by default when opening a document. To disable this behavior for a specific code block, use the "unfold" parameter.')
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, all occurrences o: .setDesc("If enabled, all occurrences of the selected text will be highlighted for easy identification.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the code will be: .setDesc("If enabled, the code will be unwrapped in reading view.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, an additional but: .setDesc("If enabled, an additional button will be displayed on every codeblock. If clicked, the content of that codeblock is deleted. Be careful!")

.setDesc("If enabled, an additional button will be displayed on every codeblock. If clicked, the content of that codeblock is selected (including the first and last lines of the code blocks which begin with three backticks).")
.setDesc("If enabled, an additional button will be displayed on every codeblock. If clicked, the content of that codeblock is wrapped/unwrapped.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, all enabled butto: .setDesc("If enabled, all enabled buttons will always be displayed, even when you click inside the code block. Otherwise, they will only be shown when the cursor is outside the code block.")
dict..setDesc('Override the default line sepa: .setDesc('Override the default line separator (|) globally for text highlighting. You can also specify it for specific code blocks using the "lsep" parameter. The separator can only be one character long!')
dict..setDesc('Override the default text sepa: .setDesc('Override the default text separator (:) globally for text highlighting. You can also specify it for specific code blocks using the "tsep" parameter. The separator can only be one character long!')
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled folding will use s: .setDesc("If enabled folding will use semi-fold method. This means, that the first X lines will be visible only. Select the number of visisble lines. You can also enable an additional uncollapse button. Please refer to the README for more information.")
dict..setDesc('Add a language, to set the col: .setDesc('Add a language, to set the colors for this specific language. If you want to set colors for code blocks without a language, add "nolang" as a language.')
dict..setDesc(\"Select on which side the bord: .setDesc("Select on which side the border should be displayed.")
dict..setDesc(\"Define a name, by which you w: .setDesc("Define a name, by which you will reference the color. You can set the color itself after adding it to the list.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the header text w: .setDesc("If enabled, the header text will be set to bold.")
.setDesc("If enabled, the header text will be set to italic.")
dict..setDesc('If enabled, code blocks withou: .setDesc('If enabled, code blocks without "fold" or "unfold" specified will not collapse when clicking the header.')
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled a collapse icon wi: .setDesc("If enabled a collapse icon will be displayed in the header. Select the position of the collapse icon.")
dict..setDesc('Overwrite the default \"Collap: .setDesc('Overwrite the default "Collapsed Code" text in the header, when the file parameter is not defined.')
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the codeblock lan: .setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language will be displayed in the header. If disabled, all below settings are disabled as well!")
.setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language text will be set to bold.")
.setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language text will be set to italic.")
.setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language will always be displayed (if a language is defined), even if the file parameter is not specified.")
.setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language icon will be displayed in the header. If disabled, all below settings are disabled as well!")
.setDesc("If enabled, the codeblock language icon will always be displayed (if a language is defined and it has an icon), even if the file parameter is not specified.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, highlighted lines: .setDesc("If enabled, highlighted lines will also highlight the gutter (line number), not just the line.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the active line n: .setDesc("If enabled, the active line number will be highlighted with a separate color.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the background co: .setDesc("If enabled, the background color, and the text color of inline code can be styled.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, the styling is ap: .setDesc("If enabled, the styling is applied to documents when printed to PDF. By default PDF printing uses light theme colors.")
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, PDF printing will: .setDesc("If enabled, PDF printing will use the dark theme colors when a dark theme is selected, and light theme colors when a light theme is selected.")
dict..setDesc('If enabled, all collapsed code: .setDesc('If enabled, all collapsed code blocks specified by the "fold" parameter will be expanded when printing. This results in the printed document containing expanded code blocks where "fold" was used.')
dict..setDesc(`Select which color you would l: .setDesc(`Select which color you would like to set for ${this.plugin.settings.languageSpecificLanguageName} specifically.`)
dict..setTooltip(\"Restore default theme to i: .setTooltip("Restore default theme to its original state")
dict..setTooltip(`Add the selected property t: .setTooltip(`Add the selected property to customize it for code block language ${languageName} specifically`)
dict..setTooltip(`Delete all language specifi: .setTooltip(`Delete all language specific colors for code block language ${languageName}`)
dict..appendText(\"If you like this plugin, a: .appendText("If you like this plugin, and would like to help support continued development, use the button below!")
dict.createTextNode(\"For more information, p: createTextNode("For more information, please read the ")
dict.'To set this color, enable the option \": 'To set this color, enable the option "Enable editor active line highlighting" first.'
'To set this color, enable the option "Enable codeblock active line highlight" first.'
dict.\"Bracket highlight color for non matchi: "Bracket highlight color for non matching brackets"
dict..setDesc(\"If enabled, in editing mode t: .setDesc("If enabled, in editing mode the 'Copy Code' button will always be visible on collapsed code blocks in the header. In reading mode the 'Copy Code' button will always be visible on collapsed and uncollapsed code blocks as well. Otherwise, it will only appear when hovering over the header (in editing mode) or the code block (in reading mode).")
dict.'To set this color, enable the option \": 'To set this color, enable the option "Display codeblock language" first.'
dict.'To set this color enable the option \"H: 'To set this color enable the option "Highlight active line number" first.'
dict.'To set this color enable the option \"E: 'To set this color enable the option "Enable inline code styling" first.'
dict..addOptions({ \"basic\": \"Basic\", \"co: .addOptions({ "basic": "Basic", "codeblock": "Codeblock", "languageSpecific": "Language specific colors", "alternateHighlight": "Alternative highlight colors", "header": "Header", "headerLanguage": "Header language", "gutter": "Gutter", "inlineCode": "Inline code", "printToPDF": "Print to PDF" })
dict.'To set this color enable the option \"H: 'To set this color enable the option "Hihglight active line number" first.'
